required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AI Activity Study in Patients With Elevated Blood Pressure
clinical_study.official_title: Applying Artificial Intelligence to a Physical Activity Intervention in Patients With Elevated Blood Pressure- a Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: In this pilot RCT, a total of 40 adults with hypertension will be randomized to either an artificial intelligence (AI) physical activity intervention group or an active control group with a 1 to 1 ratio after completing a 2-week run-in period and 4-week training. The AI intervention group will receive an automated and personalized daily step goal intervention involving a sophisticated activity analytics algorithm using advanced statistics and machine learning, while the active control group will receive a standardized and fixed 10,000 daily steps goal. Both groups will receive an identical smartphone app (app content differs between the two groups) and ActiGraph GT9X Link to assess objectively measured physical activity (primary outcome) during the study period.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in weekly daily average steps
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (run-in period), 4 week-test period, and 3-month intervention period

primary_outcome.measure: Duration (minutes) of moderate to vigorous intensity physical activity (MVPA) per day
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (run-in period), 4 week-test period, and 3-month intervention period

arm_group.description: Participants in this group receive an AI based intervention (automated and personalized daily step goal intervention involving a sophisticated activity analytics algorithm using advanced statistics and machine learning and message)
Participants in this group receive a standardized and fixed 10,000 daily steps goal intervention.

intervention.description: The intervention provides participants with an automated and personalized daily step goal intervention involving a sophisticated activity analytics algorithm using advanced statistics and machine learning.
The intervention provides participants with an automated daily 10,000 step goal intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age â‰¥18 years
- systolic blood pressure between 130 mmHg to 180 mmHg or/and diastolic blood *pressure between 80 to 100 mmHg in a research office
- speaking and reading English
- being physically inactive at work or during leisure time and willing to be physically active
- having an iPhone 8 or newer or an Android Lollipop or newer
Exclusion Criteria:
- self-reported diagnosis of coronary heart disease, medical condition or other physical problem necessitating special attention in an exercise program (e.g., cancer, eating disorder, uncontrolled diabetes)
- current participation in a lifestyle modification program or research study
- self-report of being currently pregnant.
